newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian, UK firms sign MOU to build Bombay airport.
newsitem.headline: Indian, UK firms sign MOU to build Bombay airport.

text.p: A memorandum of understanding (MOU) to develop an international airport and infrastructure facilities in Bombay was signed on Thursday between Indian and British firms, a press statement said.

The statement, issued on behalf of the concerned companies, said the MOU would look at the potential sites for the new international/domestic hub airport, together with environmental and planning studies.
The MOU will look into the infrastrcture needs of the project, including rail, road and other transport facilities, to provide a modern and fast access to the airport.
Bombay's existing airport's capacity is expected to reach a saturation point by early 21st century.
The MOU will also study the scope for extending the existing airport's economic life, the statement said.

Signatories to the MOU include Mumbai Airport Alliance of the Hinduja group, Mott MacDonald, BA Speedwing, the UK civil aviation authority, all British companies, Ashok Leyland of India and three state-run agencies of India's western state of Maharashtra.
